intro: Leiothrix tenuifolia, commonly known as the slender leiothrix, is a flowering plant belonging to the Rubiaceae family. It is native to Southeast Asia and is characterized by its delicate, linear leaves that are typically less than 1 centimeter in width. The plant produces small, white or pale yellow flowers that are clustered in inflorescences, often appearing in the axils of the leaves. It thrives in shaded, humid environments and is often found in forest understories. Due to its ornamental value, it is occasionally cultivated in tropical gardens.
